intro: Albertinia pallidiseta, commonly known as the silver-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow with a white or pale center, blooming in spring and summer. Albertinia pallidiseta is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
